java.subtitle: The foundation of enterprise software development.

core.title: Core Concepts
core.description: Java is a high-level, class-based, object-oriented programming language that is designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible.

platform.title: Platform Independent
platform.content: Write Once, Run Anywhere (WORA) capability via the Java Virtual Machine (JVM).

memory.title: Memory Management
memory.content: Automatic garbage collection handles memory allocation and deallocation.

encapsulation.title: Encapsulation
encapsulation.content: Bundling data and methods that operate on that data within a single unit.

inheritance.title: Inheritance
inheritance.content: Mechanism where a new class derives properties and characteristics from an existing class.

polymorphism.title: Polymorphism
polymorphism.content: Ability of an object to take on many forms, allowing for flexible and reusable code.

streams.title: Streams API
streams.description: Process sequences of elements declaratively with functional-style operations.

home.subtitle: Your interactive journey into the world of modern software engineering.

microservices.title: Microservices Architecture
microservices.subtitle: Decoupling applications into small, independent services.

whatIs.title: What are Microservices?
whatIs.content: Microservices architecture is an approach to building a single application as a suite of small services, each running in its own process and communicating with lightweight mechanisms, often an HTTP resource API.

decentralized.title: Decentralized Data
decentralized.content: Each service manages its own database, ensuring loose coupling but requiring eventual consistency patterns.

smartEndpoints.title: Smart Endpoints
smartEndpoints.content: Services communicate via simple REST APIs or messaging queues (RabbitMQ, Kafka), keeping logic in the services, not the pipes.

automated.title: Automated Deployment
automated.content: Requires robust CI/CD pipelines to manage the complexity of deploying multiple services.

gateway.title: API Gateway
gateway.content: A server that is the single entry point into the system. It encapsulates the internal system architecture and provides an API that is tailored to each client.

circuitBreaker.title: Circuit Breaker
circuitBreaker.content: Prevents an application from repeatedly trying to execute an operation that's likely to fail. Essential for resilience in distributed systems.

discovery.title: Service Discovery
discovery.content: Automatic detection of devices and services offered by these devices on a computer network. Tools like Eureka or Consul are commonly used.

opinionated.title: Opinionated
opinionated.content: It takes an opinionated view of the Spring platform and third-party libraries so you can get started with minimum fuss.

standalone.title: Standalone
standalone.content: Create stand-alone Spring applications that you can just run (embedded Tomcat, Jetty, or Undertow).

production.title: Production Ready
production.content: Provides production-ready features such as metrics, health checks, and externalized configuration.

quickStart.title: Quick Start
quickStart.desc: A simple REST Controller in Spring Boot.

entryPoint.title: The Entry Point
entryPoint.desc: Bootstrapping the application is as simple as annotating a class.

di.title: Dependency Injection
di.content: Spring's core feature. It allows you to decouple the creation of objects from their usage.

jpa.title: Spring Data JPA
jpa.content: Makes it easy to implement JPA based repositories. It reduces the boilerplate code required to access data.

security.title: Spring Security
security.content: A powerful and highly customizable authentication and access-control framework.

dockerK8s.title: Docker & Kubernetes
dockerK8s.subtitle: Containerization and Orchestration for modern apps.

docker.title: Docker
docker.content: Docker packages software into standardized units called containers that have everything the software needs to run including libraries, system tools, code, and runtime.

k8s.title: Kubernetes
k8s.content: Kubernetes (K8s) is an open-source system for automating deployment, scaling, and management of containerized applications.

terminal.title: Interactive Terminal
terminal.desc: Try out some common commands directly in the browser.
terminal.welcome: Welcome to the Interactive Container Lab.
terminal.hint: Try running "docker ps" or "kubectl get pods". Type "help" for more.

images.title: Images
images.content: A read-only template with instructions for creating a Docker container.

pods.title: Pods
pods.content: The smallest deployable units of computing that you can create and manage in Kubernetes.

services.title: Services
services.content: An abstract way to expose an application running on a set of Pods as a network service.

dockerfile.title: Dockerfile
dockerfile.content: A text document that contains all the commands a user could call on the command line to assemble an image.

compose.title: Docker Compose
compose.content: A tool for defining and running multi-container Docker applications.

architecture.title: K8s Architecture
architecture.content: Master Node (Control Plane) manages Worker Nodes where Pods run.

databases.title: Databases
databases.subtitle: SQL vs NoSQL: Choosing the right tool for the job.

postgres.title: PostgreSQL (SQL)
postgres.content: A powerful, open source object-relational database system with over 30 years of active development.

mongo.title: MongoDB (NoSQL)
mongo.content: A source-available cross-platform document-oriented database program. Classified as a NoSQL database program, MongoDB uses JSON-like documents.

sqlExample.title: SQL Example
sqlExample.desc: Defining a schema and inserting data in PostgreSQL.

acid.title: ACID Properties
acid.content: Atomicity, Consistency, Isolation, Durability. Guarantees validity of database transactions.

cap.title: CAP Theorem
cap.content: Consistency, Availability, Partition Tolerance. A distributed data store can only provide two of the three guarantees.

indexing.title: Indexing
indexing.content: A data structure technique used to quickly locate and access the data in a database.

sqlCard.desc: Relational databases based on structured tables and strict schemas. Ideal for complex relationships and transactional integrity.

nosqlCard.desc: Non-relational databases with flexible schemas. Designed for high performance, massive scale, and rapid development.

interactive.title: Database Playground
interactive.desc: Explore database concepts. Try "help" to see available commands.

schema.title: Schema
schema.sql: Rigid. Must be defined before inserting data.
schema.nosql: Dynamic. Can change at any time.

fedora.title: Fedora Workstation
fedora.subtitle: The premier open source development platform.

why.title: Why Fedora?
why.content: Fedora Workstation is a polished, easy to use, and complete operating system for laptops and desktops, with a complete set of tools for developers and makers of all kinds.

upstream.title: Upstream First
upstream.content: Fedora contributes directly to upstream projects. You get the latest features first.

technologies.title: Leading Edge
technologies.content: First to adopt new technologies like Wayland, PipeWire, and Btrfs by default.

containers.title: Container Ready
containers.content: Best-in-class support for Podman, Buildah, and Skopeo out of the box.

setup.title: Developer Setup
setup.desc: Essential commands to get your environment ready.

systemd.title: Systemd
systemd.content: A suite of basic building blocks for a Linux system. It provides a system and service manager that runs as PID 1 and starts the rest of the system.

firewall.title: Firewalld
firewall.content: A firewall management tool that provides a dynamically managed firewall with support for network/firewall zones.

toolbox.title: Toolbox
toolbox.content: Offers a familiar package-based environment for developing and debugging software that runs fully unprivileged using Podman.

docker.title: Docker
docker.subtitle: Containerization Mastery
docker.description: The complete guide to containerization, from basic concepts to production-grade orchestration.

kubernetes.title: Kubernetes
kubernetes.subtitle: Orchestration
kubernetes.description: Scale, manage, and automate your containerized applications with the industry-standard orchestrator.

git.title: Git
git.subtitle: Version Control
git.description: Master distributed version control with Git - the industry standard for tracking code changes and collaborating with teams.

github.title: GitHub
github.subtitle: Collaboration
github.description: The world's leading platform for version control and collaboration. Build, ship, and maintain software with millions of developers.
